For machine #2, it seems we have to prove that
D (11111111100111111111111111001111111111100011111000111111111000111111111000)^(N  )1111111110001111111110001111111110111001111111111111111111111111111111011o
yields
D (11111111100111111111111111001111111111100011111000111111111000111111111000)^(N+1)1111111110001111111110001111111110111001111111111111111111111111111111011o
in 4328 steps.
(Or might have to use N+1 & N+2, etc., to have enough bits for it to traipse over.)

Spectrum from the start:

The furthest left it had to go in the meantime was
16367 C 111000111110111000111110111000111110111000111110111000111110111000111110111000111110111000111110111000111110111000111110111000111111111111110001111100011111111100011111111100011111111100o111111111111101110111011101110111111101110111111101111111111111111111111111110111

Thus it is capable of turning
01111111110001111111110111000111111111111111111111111100i
into
1111111111111110011111111111000111110001111111110001111111110001111111110001111111110001111111110111000111111111111111111111111100i

and the most conservative lemma we could expect to prove is that for all N â‰¥ 0,																  
B (11111111111111100111111111110001111100011111111100011111111100011111111100)^(N  )01111111110001111111110111000111111111111111111111111100i
yields
B (11111111111111100111111111110001111100011111111100011111111100011111111100)^(N+1)01111111110001111111110111000111111111111111111111111100i
in 4328 steps.

------------------------------------------------

Now for some square root machines.

The differences for s11 and s31 are especially similar, the differences for s8 are pretty similar to them too.

------------------------------------------------

Now for some log machines.
(The set of all log machines seems to be #s 9, 10, 15, 26, 32, 33, 34, 35.)
